title: Research
text:
In general, I’m deeply interested in measuring political attitudes and opinions primarily using dimensional scaling and machine learning. Furthermore, I have an ongoing research project with Jack Rametta on incorporating machine learning into experimental analyses in the social sciences. So far, my previous research has worked to better understand COVID attitudes and behaviors and the dimensionality of affective polarization.

title: Sam Fuller
text:
Hi there! I’m a PhD Candidate in political science at the University of California, Davis.
My substantive research focuses on better understanding public opinion, political behavior, and political psychology. Particularly, I study ideological and affective polarization as well as partisanship as an identity and am looking at its affects on policy preferences and anti-democratic attitudes. Previously, I’ve also worked significantly on COVID-19 attitudes, behaviors, and policy outcomes.
My methodological research is primarily focused on bridging the gap between methodologists and substantive scholars. In particular, I’m currently focused on incorporating machine learning tools into researchers’ toolsets for analyzing experiments.
